title: Research Methodology: An Interactive Journey - From Mystery to Method
description: A comprehensive, interactive course on research methodology for BSc Zoology students, featuring 10 Jupyter notebooks with hands-on demonstrations, regional examples from Western Odisha, and a unique philosophical approach bridging human mystery to biological research.

creators.name: Patel, Alok
creators.affiliation: Department of Zoology, Kuchinda College, Sambalpur University

references: Kothari, C. R. (2004). Research Methodology: Methods and Techniques. New Age International.
Cohen, J. (1988). Statistical Power Analysis for the Behavioral Sciences. Lawrence Erlbaum Associates.
notes: This course uses the 'Pattern Hunters' pedagogy, moving from concrete regional examples (Western Odisha biodiversity) to abstract universal principles. It begins with a philosophical exploration of emergence and mystery, then bridges to systematic biological research methods. Version 1.1 includes comprehensive experimental design coverage.
